lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kwco pwro Kwq aupjY ibkwr gwiq rom rom kY iprwiq mhw duK pweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Kaacho Paaro Khaat Oupajai Bikaar Gaati , Rom Rom Kai Piraati Mahaa Doukh Paaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as consuming raw mercury causes such a disorder in the body that causes pain in every limb and one feels discomfort.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau lsn Kwey moin kY sBw mY bYTy pRgtY durgMD nwih durq durweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Lasan Khaaay Moni Kai Sabhaa Mai Baitthay , Pragatai Duragandh Naahi Durat Duraaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as after eating garlic one may remain silent in an assembly, even then its foul odour cannot be hidden.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy imstwn pwin sMgm kY mwKI lIly hoq auklyd Kydu sMkt shweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Misataan Paani Sangam Kai Maakhee Leelay , Hot Oukalayd Khaydu Sankat Sahaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a person may swallow a fly while eating sweetmeat, he vomits immediately. He bears much suffering and distress.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy hI Aprcy ipMf isKn kI iBiKAw Kwey AMq kwl BwrI hoie jm lok jweIAY ]517]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Hee Aparachay Pind Sikhan Kee Bhikhiaa Khaaay , Ant Kaal Bhaaree Hoi Jam Lok Jaaeeai ?517?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly an ignorant person consumes the offerings made by the devotees of the True Guru. He suffers much at the time of his death. He has to face the wrath of the angels of death.  (517)
